meanings.definition: to make (something) seem environmentally friendly or sustainable, especially in a misleading way.
meanings.sent1: The company greenwashes its products to attract eco-conscious customers.
meanings.sent2: She greenwashes her image by promoting eco-friendly practices.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox greenwashes its den to trick other animals.
meanings.sent4: His words greenwashes the truth, hiding the real impact of his actions.
meanings.sent5: The magician greenwashes reality, creating an illusion of environmental responsibility.

meanings.definition: the act of making (something) seem environmentally friendly or sustainable, especially in a misleading way.
meanings.sent1: Greenwashes can harm the environment by promoting false ideas.
meanings.sent2: The greenwashes of some companies mislead consumers about their practices.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about a superhero who greenwashes his secret lair.
meanings.sent4: The movie director greenwashes the set, transforming it into a lush forest.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting greenwashes pollution, turning it into a beautiful landscape.
